trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory Integration with Mimecast Personal Portal | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory Integration with Mimecast Personal Portal | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Mimecast Personal Portal with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Mimecast Personal Portal with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.

trans-unit.source: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and Mimecast Personal Portal.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and Mimecast Personal Portal.

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:

trans-unit.source: A valid Azure subscription
trans-unit.target: A valid Azure subscription

trans-unit.source: A Mimecast Personal Portal single sign-on enabled subscription
trans-unit.target: A Mimecast Personal Portal single sign-on enabled subscription

trans-unit.source: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to Mimecast Personal Portal will be able to single sign into the application at your Mimecast Personal Portal company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to Mimecast Personal Portal will be able to single sign into the application at your Mimecast Personal Portal company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for Mimecast Personal Portal
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for Mimecast Personal Portal

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on

trans-unit.source: Configuring user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configuring user provisioning

trans-unit.source: Assigning users
trans-unit.target: Assigning users

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for Mimecast Personal Portal.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for Mimecast Personal Portal.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>

trans-unit.source: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.
trans-unit.target: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.

trans-unit.source: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.
trans-unit.target: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Applications</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Applications</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Add at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click Add at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add application</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add application</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.
trans-unit.target: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the search box, type Mimecast Personal Portal.
trans-unit.target: In the search box, type Mimecast Personal Portal.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the results pane, select Mimecast Personal Portal, and then click Complete to add the application.
trans-unit.target: In the results pane, select Mimecast Personal Portal, and then click Complete to add the application.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Mimecast Personal Portal</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Mimecast Personal Portal</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to Mimecast Personal Portal with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to Mimecast Personal Portal with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.

trans-unit.source: As part of this procedure, you are required to create a base-64 encoded certificate file.
trans-unit.target: As part of this procedure, you are required to create a base-64 encoded certificate file.

trans-unit.source: If you are not familiar with this procedure, see <linkText>How to convert a binary certificate into a text file</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: If you are not familiar with this procedure, see <linkText>How to convert a binary certificate into a text file</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, on the Mimecast Personal Portal application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, on the Mimecast Personal Portal application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the How would you like users to sign on to Mimecast Personal Portal page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the How would you like users to sign on to Mimecast Personal Portal page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure App URL page, in the Mimecast Personal Portal Sign On URL textbox, type the URL used by your users to sign on to your Mimecast Personal Portal application (e.g.: “https://webmail-uk.mimecast.com” or “https://webmail-us.mimecast.com”), and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure App URL page, in the Mimecast Personal Portal Sign On URL textbox, type the URL used by your users to sign on to your Mimecast Personal Portal application (e.g.: “https://webmail-uk.mimecast.com” or “https://webmail-us.mimecast.com”), and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: The sign on URL is region specific.
trans-unit.target: The sign on URL is region specific.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure App URL</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure App URL</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure single sign-on at Mimecast Personal Portal page, to download your certificate, click Download certificate, and then save the certificate file locally on your computer.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure single sign-on at Mimecast Personal Portal page, to download your certificate, click Download certificate, and then save the certificate file locally on your computer.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In a different web browser window, log into your Mimecast Personal Portal as an administrator.
trans-unit.target: In a different web browser window, log into your Mimecast Personal Portal as an administrator.

trans-unit.source: Go to Services \> Application.
trans-unit.target: Go to Services \> Application.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Applications</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Applications</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Authentication Profiles.
trans-unit.target: Click Authentication Profiles.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Authentication Profiles</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Authentication Profiles</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click New Authentication Profile.
trans-unit.target: Click New Authentication Profile.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>New Authentication Profil</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>New Authentication Profil</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Authentication Profile section, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: In the Authentication Profile section, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Authentication Profil</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Authentication Profil</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Description textbox, type a name for your configuration.
trans-unit.target: In the Description textbox, type a name for your configuration.

trans-unit.source: Select Enforce SAML Authentication for Mimecast Personal Portal.
trans-unit.target: Select Enforce SAML Authentication for Mimecast Personal Portal.

trans-unit.source: As Provider, select Azure Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: As Provider, select Azure Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Mimecast Personal Portal dialog page, copy the Issuer URL value, and then paste it into the Issuer URL textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Mimecast Personal Portal dialog page, copy the Issuer URL value, and then paste it into the Issuer URL textbox.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Mimecast Personal Portal dialog page, copy the Remote Login URL value, and then paste it into the Login URL textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Mimecast Personal Portal dialog page, copy the Remote Login URL value, and then paste it into the Login URL textbox.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Mimecast Personal Portal dialog page, copy the Remote Login URL value, and then paste it into the Logout URL textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Mimecast Personal Portal dialog page, copy the Remote Login URL value, and then paste it into the Logout URL textbox.

trans-unit.source: The Login URL value and the Logout URL value are for the -on at Mimecast Personal Portal the same.
trans-unit.target: The Login URL value and the Logout URL value are for the -on at Mimecast Personal Portal the same.

trans-unit.source: Create a base-64 encoded file from your downloaded certificate.
trans-unit.target: Create a base-64 encoded file from your downloaded certificate.

trans-unit.source: For more details, see <linkText>How to convert a binary certificate into a text file</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more details, see <linkText>How to convert a binary certificate into a text file</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Open your base-64 encoded certificate in notepad, remove the first line (“--“) and the last line (“--“), copy the remaining content of it into your clipboard, and then paste it to the Identity Provider Certificate (Metadata) textbox.
trans-unit.target: Open your base-64 encoded certificate in notepad, remove the first line (“--“) and the last line (“--“), copy the remaining content of it into your clipboard, and then paste it to the Identity Provider Certificate (Metadata) textbox.

trans-unit.source: Select Allow Single Sign On.
trans-unit.target: Select Allow Single Sign On.

trans-unit.source: Click Save.
trans-unit.target: Click Save.

trans-unit.source: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.
trans-unit.target: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into Mimecast Personal Portal, they must be provisioned into Mimecast Personal Portal.
trans-unit.target: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into Mimecast Personal Portal, they must be provisioned into Mimecast Personal Portal.

trans-unit.source: In the case of Mimecast Personal Portal, provisioning is a manual task.
trans-unit.target: In the case of Mimecast Personal Portal, provisioning is a manual task.

trans-unit.source: You need to register a domain before you can create users.
trans-unit.target: You need to register a domain before you can create users.

trans-unit.source: Sign on to your Mimecast Personal Portal as administrator.
trans-unit.target: Sign on to your Mimecast Personal Portal as administrator.

trans-unit.source: Go to Directories \> Internal.
trans-unit.target: Go to Directories \> Internal.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Directories</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Directories</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Register New Domain.
trans-unit.target: Click Register New Domain.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Register New Domain</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Register New Domain</linkText>

trans-unit.source: After your new domain has been created, click New Address.
trans-unit.target: After your new domain has been created, click New Address.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>New Address</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>New Address</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the new address dialog, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: In the new address dialog, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Save</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Save</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Type the Email Address, Global Name, Password and Confirm Password attributes of a valid AAD account you want to provision into the related textboxes.
trans-unit.target: Type the Email Address, Global Name, Password and Confirm Password attributes of a valid AAD account you want to provision into the related textboxes.

trans-unit.source: Click Save.
trans-unit.target: Click Save.

trans-unit.source: You can use any other Mimecast Personal Portal user account creation tools or APIs provided by Mimecast Personal Portal to provision AAD user accounts.
trans-unit.target: You can use any other Mimecast Personal Portal user account creation tools or APIs provided by Mimecast Personal Portal to provision AAD user accounts.

trans-unit.source: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.
trans-unit.target: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.

trans-unit.source: On the Mimecast Personal Portal **application integration page, click **Assign users.
trans-unit.target: On the Mimecast Personal Portal **application integration page, click **Assign users.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Assign Users</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Assign Users</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.
trans-unit.target: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Yes</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Yes</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.
trans-unit.target: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.

trans-unit.source: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
